etymology.description: 𠂤 ("mound, hill") + 帀 ("to surround") = ancient troops stationed at a hill -> teacher
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the idea of a command post at a strategic location, represented by a mound surrounded by troops, reflecting the organized, guiding role of a teacher in leading and instructing groups.
etymology.simplification: In 师(師), the component 帀 has been omitted and the character simplified to form a more straightforward structure.

examples.chinese: 他是我的师(他是我的師)。
我向音乐师请教(我向音樂師請教)，提高表演技巧(提高表演技巧)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiàng yīnyuè shī qǐngjiào, tígāo biǎoyǎn jìqiǎo.
examples.english: I consult the music teacher to improve my performance skills.

examples.chinese: 她渴望成为一名优秀的师(她渴望成為一名優秀的師)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kěwàng chéngwéi yī míng yōuxiù de shī.
examples.english: She aspires to become an excellent teacher.
